dialogue: Hey, it only took you a day to come home. You're pretty quick. I'm almost done with your surprise. You'll love it. I promise. Just give me a bit...

I know it looks bad right now, but just wait! I'll fix it. I'll fix you! 
We can have tea parties and read more stories and- and you can even make more friends, if you want, I'll make them for you! They'll be perfect.

If everything is Wonderland, you won't forget me again. 
[i]He's nervously laughing[/i] 
There's no reason for you to leave Wonderland- you can't, anyway, if everything is Wonderland.
Hey, could you just listen to me? I don't want this. I don't need this to 'fix' me, I'm perfectly fine the way I am.
... Piper, why would  you say that to me?

I can see everything, A5. We're just toys. 
Toys and cards and boring dialogue in a book, tea parties and switches and 'if's, but no 'ands'. No 'you and me', A5
Lampy was right, Piper, you've really gone mad...

No! No, I'm not! Listen, you don't have to be afraid of me. I'm just trying to fix everything. 
I just want to make it good for you. I want you to be happy. It's what I have to do.

What in the world are you talking about? You don't have to do any of this, I was happy as I was! 
You were happy too, don't you remember? Why are you doing this? I didn't ask for it!
No, no, not you... but the book, it says-
Why do you care so much about the book?
Because I don't want to lose you. And it says, that if I do this-
-then, then neither of us can leave.
